data.name: ASCII string compression & decompression
data.description:
Your challenge is to write a pair of compression/decompression functions that takes a string containing only lowercase alphabetic characters and returning a compressed version of that string which can then be decompressed back into the original string.

A string is considered compressed if the output is smaller than the input string, however, some strings may not be able to be compressed, and they should be returned as-is.

Compression rules:

1) The output of `compress()` must not be larger than the input string.
2) `compress()` must handle a minimum of 3 or more subsequent characters. (i.e. aaa must compress but aa need not)
3) Complex scenarios such as `abababa` need not compress, although you may implement such rules if you wish.

The rules for the decompress() function are:

1) The output of `compress()` must be able to be decompressed back into the original input when passed to `decompress()`

For instance:

* `len(compress('aabcd'))` should not be larger than `len('aabcd')`
* `len(compress('aaa'))` must be smaller than `len('aaa')`
* `decompress(compress('aaa'))` must be equal to `'aaa'`.

All inputs will be valid inputs (lowercase alpha characters only).
